oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Yearbook “Salmagundi,” of the Boscobel College for Young Ladies, Nashville, Tennessee, 1909
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The 1909 yearbook, known as “Salmagundi,” published by the Boscobel College for Young Ladies, featuring students, faculty, trustees, clubs, athletics, societies, and more. The Board of Trustees included the Officers: Rev. A. C. Cree (President); R.B.C. Howell (Secy. And Treasurer); Members: M.F. Greene; Dr. J.P. Gray; W.V. Davidson; F.M. Dorris; H.W. Buttorff; Col. W.M. Woodcock; John W. Love; Byrd Murray; W.W. Napier; and J.M. Warren; the Executive Committee: W.W. Napier and W.V. Davidson; and Finance Committee: H.W. Buttorff, Chairman, and John W. Love. The Boscobel College for Young Ladies was a college in East Nashville, founded in 1889 as the Nashville Baptist Female College by the Tennessee Baptist Convention. The college operated for twenty-five years--until 1914. The campus was built around an East Nashville mansion, formerly owned by Anna Shelby Williams. The mansion stood atop a tree-covered hill overlooking the Cumberland River. The campus covered ten wooded acres on Sevier Street near South Seventh Street (then called Foster Street), south of Sylvan Street. In 1918, the property became home to the National Baptist Seminary and Missionary Training School, which functioned until 1931. The buildings were razed in 1940. The advertisers in the yearbook include the Ambrose Printing Company; Auten-Gainer Company; Claude J. Bell; W.G. Bush & Co.; George R. Calhoun & Co.; Calvert Brothers; Confederate Veteran; M. Cook & Co.; Cooperative Dental Supply Company; Corbitt; Cornelius; Crone & Jackson; W.J. Cude Land and Lumber Company; Cumberland Telephone and Telegraph Company; Demerich & Shea; DeMoville Drug Company; M.E. Derryberry & Co.; Dorris-Kepler Camera Company; G.C. Dury & Co.; Webb Foster & Parkes; Fourth National Bank; A. Frank & Co.; H.A. French; Fulcher-Brick Company; Geny Brothers; Gray-Fox Tailoring Company; Greenfield-Talbot-Finney-Battle Company; Harris-Davis Company; A. L. Hayes Company; H.G. Hill, Grocer & Baking Company; Howe Ice Company; Jesse French Piano & Organ Company; Johnson, Wade & Bosworth; Joy & Son; Jungermann & Rust; Kentucky Coal Mining Company; Miss W. Keplinger; E.T. Lewis Company; Love, Boyd & Co.; Loventhal, Frank & Co. (Nashville, Tenn.); D. Lowenheim & Co.; McEwen Laundry; Maxwell House; Nashville Railway and Light Company; The Ocean; Phillips & Buttorff Manufacturing Company; Rice Bureau; George F. Roth Real Estate; Sand-Sumpter Drug Company; E.J. Schott; Smith & Lamar; Standard Furniture Company; F.H. Stickley; Stief; Taylor; Thuss; W.F. Trousdale; Tulane Hotel; Union Bank and Trust Company; Vanderbilt Law Department; Dallas M. Villines; Jack Walters; Warren Brothers; Weatherhold Piano Company; A.H. Wenning; White Trunk and Bag Company; Wolfe Tailoring Company; and the Wright Brothers. Forms part of the yearbook collection: Boscobel College, “Salmagundi,” 1909. 1 volume
